page.title: 05THE DEVIL'S STONE
page.content: The Devil's stone is a large rock which lies in front of the great oak which stands before the church room in Shebbear village.A few years ago scientists extracted a small piece of it and found it was unlike any other rock in our area.Our vicar has a theory that the stone was put there in the Anglo Saxon period when people believed in the Pagon Gods and used it as a place of worship.Every year the church bellringers with crowbars turn over the stone.The vicar believes that this custom started when some people still worshiped the pagan gods but the main were Christians.They turned over the stone to show what they thought of the pagan gods.It is the oldest living custom in Europe.
